ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.
Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

editorialNotes.standard: Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers we’ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

name: Smart Baby Shapes: Learning games for toddler kids

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle series’ fantastic conclusion.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!
editorialNotes.standard: Goofy banter, diverting puzzles, wall-to-wall action—we couldn’t ask for more from a LEGO Ninjago game. Using the warriors’ trademark weapons and elemental moves, you’ll battle the nefarious Ronin and his crew across Chen’s Island, the Toxic Bogs, and other familiar settings. Even if you’ve never seen the Masters of Spinjitzu animated series, these hilarious heroes and their kid-friendly shenanigans are guaranteed to win you over.

Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles, and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. It’s no wonder it’s an Honorable Mention for Best Mobile Game at this year’s Game Developers Conference. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldn’t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beauty—and this sequel didn’t let us down. With its striking colors and level design, it’s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what we’ll remember most, though—their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: A powerful bond between mother and child drives this gorgeous, unforgettable game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Put a little “boo” in your botany by concocting herbal remedies for odd supernatural ailments in this eerie puzzle-adventure.

Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.
Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

A terrific follow-up to our 2012 iPad Game of the Year, The Room Two continues the dark, foreboding tale introduced in its predecessor. Marvelously detailed graphics and eerie music make this first-person puzzler feel stunningly real, and as you travel from an ancient crypt to a séance room and beyond, you’ll love unlocking the secrets of every object—and learning more about your mysterious imprisonment.

In Baba Is You’s brilliant puzzles, rules are meant to be broken—or at least rewritten. Brick wall standing between you and the victory flag? Shift blocks of text to form phrases that change the way the world works. With a few moves, “wall is stop” becomes “wall is push”—and success is suddenly within your grasp. You’ll marvel as the game responds instantly to your newly created laws. Spell yourself into a corner? Just rewind and retrace your steps. Baba is you, and you’re in charge.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Donut County is an absolute treat. You drag holes across land to collect bigger and bigger aboveground objects, from puddles and fire pits to trees and boulders. New ideas change gameplay in intriguing ways, and concepts never overstay their welcome, making every puzzle feel new and interesting. The consequences of every hole you control propel a wonderfully quirky story about a suddenly subterranean society seeking a return to the surface. Along with the game’s fantastic visual style and marvelous soundtrack, its every idiosyncrasy miraculously blends into an inviting, cohesive whole.
editorialNotes.short: Geneva Hodgson: Story editor, Donut County

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a line—any line—and watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect colored dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, it’s a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

ios.subtitle: Like a jigsaw of your insides.

editorialNotes.standard: Cool features like asynchronous multiplayer uplift the mobile version of this hit tabletop word association game.

State of Play’s brilliant adventure game lets you journey through a spellbinding paper world that has to be seen to be believed. Created in a complex process that’s part origami and part stop motion, Lumino City’s highly polished environments come to life like nothing you’ve ever seen. But it’s not just the backdrops that captivate—this unique point-and-click adventure melds clever puzzles with a heartwarming story to powerful effect.
editorialNotes.short: Explore a beautiful handmade city in this stunning puzzler.

editorialNotes.standard: Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.
Peek under roofs and rummage through spaceships to track down objects in this delightful time-hopping puzzler.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALL·E directed by Tim Burton—that’s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robot’s quest for love combines tons more influences—like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic books—for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome “aha!” moments, it’s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.
Get to know your enemy—and try to predict their behavior—as you solve puzzles in this adventure game’s top-down dungeons.
Tug, twist, and bend orbits to reach harmonic chimes in this meditative musical puzzler.

editorialNotes.tagline: This party game is the bomb!

editorialNotes.standard: The Gardens Between is pure magic. Two friends are transported to a cluster of surreal, spiraling islands populated with treasures from childhood memories. An elegant control system lets you manipulate time to help the pair navigate beautiful puzzles that evoke growth, loss, and friendship. A contemplative game that rewards observation and curiosity, The Gardens Between's inspired creativity is full of heart.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

Imagination becomes reality in 5th Cell’s spectacular puzzler—just write the name of almost anything in a magical notebook, and it appears before you. Expanding on the more linear Scribblenauts Remix, this game turns you loose to explore an open world. By creating everything from flying pigs to rocket launchers, you solve problems big and small for the people you meet. As the freedom to roam met the freedom to create, we got lost in coming up with the zaniest, most outlandish, or sometimes most diabolical ways to solve each scenario.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Merge numbers to create bigger numbers and repeat to avoid gridlock. The formula may be straightforward, but Threes!’s simplicity belies an endlessly gratifying and remarkably original game that rewards thoughtful strategy over frenzied swiping. With its lovingly crafted design, whimsical music, and unforgettable gameplay, Threes! is a delightful experience you’ll return to again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore a gorgeous island packed with intricately interwoven puzzles. There’s a subtle logic to the world design that connects structures, land configurations, and puzzle grids. For persistent adventurers, The Witness is an unforgettable experience.

They say don’t wake sleeping dogs, but poor Mimpi has been having some very weird dreams. From laboratories to forests to dangerous, debris-strewn waters, the only similarity between Mimpi’s dreamscapes is how fun they are to navigate. Each stage is filled with puzzles to solve and environmental objects to fiddle with. You’ll knock down power lines, steer clouds, push suitcases, and (of course!) collect bones on your exhilarating journey through dreamlands.

editorialNotes.tagline: A clever way to play with light
editorialNotes.standard: What secrets lie in the shadows of this Apple Design Award–winning puzzler? By twisting and turning unfathomable objects, you cast shadows on beautifully rendered backgrounds; manipulate them just right and you’ll find shapes you’d never have expected—from rabbits to wrenches. Soothing ambient music and thematic backdrops make completing each challenge as much meditation as entertainment—while timers and achievements give each level a competitive feel.
editorialNotes.short: With stunning visuals and satisfying solutions, this game is one to savour.

editorialNotes.standard: We love how Moncage’s puzzles show the importance of seeing things from different perspectives. The storytelling vignettes packed into the faces of a rotating cube connect and combine in ever-evolving, surprising ways, and the challenge of making those connections sparks creativity and renders the impossible suddenly possible. Rarely has the concept of thinking outside the box been illustrated so well.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Brain Game Fun, Easy to Hard

editorialNotes.standard: Sewing patterns on quilts so adorable kitties will curl up on them for a nap? Board games don’t get much cozier than this.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Lightbot Jr : Coding Puzzles for Ages 4+

editorialNotes.tagline: Discover a memorable story full of humour
editorialNotes.standard: Double Fine’s riveting point-and-click adventure thrusts players into a timeless blend of whimsical sci-fi and dark fairy tale. Clever writing and stylish visuals keep its intersecting stories appealing—and at times, wickedly funny—with characters you’ll quickly become attached to (voiced by Elijah Wood, Jack Black, and other popular actors). Initially available with Act 1 only, Broken Age now includes the complete game—a one-of-a-kind odyssey that’s full of memorable moments.
editorialNotes.short: Discover a memorable story full of humor and charming characters.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Enigmatis: The Ghosts of Maple Creek (Full)
